document_data.name: Gate of Elephants
document_data.Location: The Gate of Elephants was located on the southern wall of the city. It opened to a garden right before the Royal Lagoon within Muluk and led to the docks.
document_data.Description: A pair of [[elephant]]s were carved into the framework of the gate, giving the portal its name.
document_data.Inhabitants: A garrison of 200 soldiers was stationed at the Gate of Elephants, making the gate a fortress as much as it was an entryway into Muluk.
